[{"Query":{"text":"THIS IS WINDOWS RESPONSE TO YOU FROM WARP

Great â€” hereâ€™s a ready-to-use LaunchAgent for your Mac (no admin) that starts a resilient reverse SSH tunnel to your Windows box at 192.168.132.70. It uses autossh if available; otherwise it falls back to ssh.

What it does
â€¢  From your Mac (user: davidquinton) it opens a reverse tunnel on your Windows PC (user: DQuinton) to expose your Macâ€™s SSH on Windows port 2222.
â€¢  Reconnects automatically if the connection drops.
â€¢  Starts at login and stays up.

1) Install autossh (recommended, no admin)
brew install autossh

2) Save this LaunchAgent on your Mac
â€¢  File: ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.davidquinton.reverse-ssh.plist
â€¢  Contents:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN"
 "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
  <dict>
    <key>Label</key>
    <string>com.davidquinton.reverse-ssh</string>

    <key>ProgramArguments</key>
    <array>
      <string>/bin/sh</string>
      <string>-c</string>
      <string>
        if command -v autossh >/dev/null 2>&1; then
          AUTOSSH_GATETIME=0 AUTOSSH_LOGLEVEL=0 AUTOSSH_POLL=60 AUTOSSH_FIRST_POLL=30 \
          autossh -M 0 -N -o ServerAliveInterval=60 -o ServerAliveCountMax=3 \
                  -o StrictHostKeyChecking=accept-new \
                  -R 2222:localhost:22 DQuinton@192.168.132.70
        else
          ssh -N -o ServerAliveInterval=60 -o ServerAliveCountMax=3 \
              -o ExitOnForwardFailure=yes \
              -o StrictHostKeyChecking=accept-new \
              -R 2222:localhost:22 DQuinton@192.168.132.70
        fi
      </string>
    </array>

    <key>RunAtLoad</key>
    <true/>

    <key>KeepAlive</key>
    <dict>
      <key>SuccessfulExit</key>
      <false/>
      <key>NetworkState</key>
      <true/>
    </dict>

    <key>StandardOutPath</key>
    <string>/Users/davidquinton/Library/Logs/reverse-ssh.log</string>
    <key>StandardErrorPath</key>
    <string>/Users/davidquinton/Library/Logs/reverse-ssh.err</string>

    <key>ProcessType</key>
    <string>Background</string>

    <key>EnvironmentVariables</key>
    <dict>
      <key>LANG</key><string>en_US.UTF-8</string>
      <key>LC_ALL</key><string>en_US.UTF-8</string>
    </dict>
  </dict>
</plist>

3) Load it (start now and at login)
launchctl load -w ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.davidquinton.reverse-ssh.plist

4) Verify itâ€™s running
â€¢  Check status:
  launchctl print gui/$(id -u)/com.davidquinton.reverse-ssh 2>/dev/null | sed -n '1,120p'
â€¢  Watch logs:
  log stream --predicate 'process CONTAINS "autossh" OR process CONTAINS "ssh"' --style compact

5) Use the tunnel from Windows
ssh -p 2222 davidquinton@localhost

Notes and tips
â€¢  macOS SSH server: Ensure Remote Login is enabled (System Settings > General > Sharing > Remote Login ON).
â€¢  Windows IP: Current Wiâ€‘Fi IPv4 is 192.168.132.70. If it changes later, update the plist and reload.
â€¢  Key-based auth: Make sure your Macâ€™s public key is in C:\Users\DQuinton.ssh\authorized_keys on Windows (you appear to have this set already).
â€¢  Change port if 2222 is busy: Swap 2222 for something else in the -R mapping and in the Windows ssh -p command.
â€¢  Make the tunnel reachable beyond localhost: On Windows, set GatewayPorts yes in C:\ProgramData\ssh\sshd_config and restart the sshd service. Also open Windows Firewall for TCP 2222. Only do this if you need remote hosts (not recommended unless necessary).

Uninstall or stop
â€¢  Stop now (keep Loaded=false): launchctl unload -w ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.davidquinton.reverse-ssh.plist
â€¢  Remove file: rm ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.davidquinton.reverse-ssh.plist

Got it â€” hereâ€™s an end-to-end, battle-tested setup to get a reliable SSH reverse tunnel from your Mac into your Windows box, plus a one-liner you can paste on the Mac once everythingâ€™s ready.

Summary
â€¢  Windows username: DQuinton (from C:\Users\DQuinton)
â€¢  Youâ€™ll run the reverse tunnel from the Mac to Windows
â€¢  Youâ€™ll then SSH from Windows back to your Mac via localhost:2222

1) Prep Windows (OpenSSH Server)
Run these in an elevated PowerShell (Run as Administrator) on Windows:

â€¢  Install and start the SSH server, enable at boot:
  Add-WindowsCapability -Online -Name OpenSSH.Server~~~~0.0.1.0
  Start-Service sshd
  Set-Service -Name sshd -StartupType Automatic

â€¢  Allow SSH in the firewall:
  New-NetFirewallRule -Name OpenSSH-Server-In-TCP -DisplayName "OpenSSH Server (Inbound)" -Enabled True -Direction Inbound -Protocol TCP -Action Allow -LocalPort 22

â€¢  Verify itâ€™s listening:
  netstat -ano | findstr ":22"

2) Find your Windows IP (needed on the Mac)
Any one of these:
â€¢  PowerShell: (Get-NetIPAddress -AddressFamily IPv4 -InterfaceAlias "Ethernet","Wi-Fi" -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object {$_.IPAddress -notmatch '^169\.'}).IPAddress
â€¢  Or classic: ipconfig

Note the IPv4 (e.g., 192.168.1.50). Youâ€™ll use it as WINDOWS_IP below.

3) Prep key-based auth (recommended)
On your Mac:

â€¢  Ensure you have an SSH key (create if needed):
  ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -f ~/.ssh/id_ed25519 -N ""

â€¢  Show your public key:
  cat ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub
  Copy the output.

On Windows (PowerShell as your normal user, not Admin):
â€¢  Make SSH dir and set permissions:
  New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force $HOME\.ssh | Out-Null
  Set-Content -Path $HOME\.ssh\authorized_keys -Value ""
  icacls $HOME\.ssh /inheritance:r
  icacls $HOME\.ssh /grant "$env:USERNAME:(OI)(CI)F" "$env:COMPUTERNAME\SYSTEM:(OI)(CI)F"
  icacls $HOME\.ssh\authorized_keys /inheritance:r
  icacls $HOME\.ssh\authorized_keys /grant "$env:USERNAME:F" "$env:COMPUTERNAME\SYSTEM:F"

â€¢  Paste your Mac public key into C:\Users\DQuinton.ssh\authorized_keys (append; one line).

4) Enable SSH on the Mac (the side youâ€™ll connect back into)
â€¢  Turn on Remote Login:
  sudo systemsetup -setremotelogin on
â€¢  Confirm SSH (macOS 13+ typically has it):
  sudo launchctl print system/com.openssh.sshd 2>/dev/null || echo "sshd will be started on demand"

5) One-line command (run this on the Mac)
Replace WINDOWS_IP with your Windows IP from step 2.

â€¢  Basic, interactive (press Ctrl+C to stop):
  ssh -N -o ServerAliveInterval=60 -o ServerAliveCountMax=3 -R 2222:localhost:22 DQuinton@WINDOWS_IP

What it does:
â€¢  Creates a reverse tunnel on the Windows host listening at 127.0.0.1:2222
â€¢  Traffic to that port goes back to your Macâ€™s SSH (port 22)

6) Use the tunnel from Windows
In a normal PowerShell (non-admin) on Windows:
â€¢  Connect to your Mac through the tunnel:
  ssh -p 2222 YOUR_MAC_USERNAME@localhost

Tip: If your Mac account name contains spaces or you use iCloud-managed names, check your exact username on Mac with whoami.

7) Make it resilient (optional but recommended)
Option A: autossh on Mac (keeps tunnel alive)
â€¢  Install autossh (e.g., with Homebrew): brew install autossh
â€¢  Launch once interactively:
  autossh -M 0 -N -o ServerAliveInterval=60 -o ServerAliveCountMax=3 -R 2222:localhost:22 DQuinton@WINDOWS_IP

Option B: launchd on Mac (auto-start at login)
â€¢  Create ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.user.reverse-ssh.plist with a ProgramArguments array like:
  /usr/local/bin/autossh
  -M
  0
  -N
  -o
  ServerAliveInterval=60
  -o
  ServerAliveCountMax=3
  -R
  2222:localhost:22
  DQuinton@WINDOWS_IP
â€¢  Load it:
  launchctl load -w ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.user.reverse-ssh.plist
â€¢  Check logs with: log stream --predicate 'process == "autossh"' --style compact

8) Common pitfalls and fixes
â€¢  Permission denied (publickey) on Windows:
â€¢  Ensure your Mac public key is in C:\Users\DQuinton.ssh\authorized_keys
â€¢  Windows ACLs must be tight (use the icacls commands above)
â€¢  Restart service after changes: Restart-Service sshd
â€¢  Connection refused when creating tunnel:
â€¢  Confirm Windows sshd is running: Get-Service sshd
â€¢  Confirm port 22 is open on Windows firewall (rule above)
â€¢  Ensure youâ€™re using the correct WINDOWS_IP (on the same network/VPN)
â€¢  Canâ€™t SSH back to the Mac via localhost:2222:
â€¢  Ensure macOS Remote Login is enabled (step 4)
â€¢  From Windows, test the local endpoint: Test-NetConnection -ComputerName localhost -Port 2222
â€¢  Try verbose:
    ssh -vvv -p 2222 YOUR_MAC_USERNAME@localhost

â€¢  Need Windows to accept external connects to port 2222 (not just localhost):
â€¢  By default, -R binds localhost on the remote (Windows). If you want 0.0.0.0:2222, add a bind address:
    ssh -N -o ServerAliveInterval=60 -o ServerAliveCountMax=3 -R 0.0.0.0:2222:localhost:22 DQuinton@WINDOWS_IP
â€¢  And on Windows, set in C:\ProgramData\ssh\sshd_config:
    GatewayPorts yes
    Then: Restart-Service sshd
â€¢  Add Windows firewall rule for 2222 if needed:
    New-NetFirewallRule -Name "ReverseSSH-2222" -DisplayName "Reverse SSH 2222" -Enabled True -Direction Inbound -Protocol TCP -Action Allow -LocalPort 2222

â€¢  NAT/Double NAT:
â€¢  Reverse tunnel avoids inbound NAT to Windows, but the Mac must be able to reach WINDOWS_IP (same LAN or VPN).
â€¢  DNS confusion:
â€¢  Prefer the raw IPv4 from ipconfig / Get-NetIPAddress.
â€¢  If Windows hostname resolves to IPv6 or wrong interface, use the IPv4 directly.

9) Quick verification checklist
â€¢  Windows: sshd running, port 22 allowed, authorized_keys present, ACLs correct
â€¢  Mac: Remote Login enabled, SSH key exists, can reach WINDOWS_IP
â€¢  Start tunnel on Mac (one-liner)
â€¢  From Windows: ssh -p 2222 YOUR_MAC_USERNAME@localhost

If you want, I can help you:
â€¢  Get your exact Windows IP from here
â€¢  Generate the Mac key and show you exactly how to paste it into authorized_keys on Windows
â€¢  Provide a ready-to-paste launchd file for persistence on your Mac

Say â€œget my Windows IPâ€ and Iâ€™ll give you the exact command to run here and what to paste on the Mac.

This file provides guidance to WARP (warp.dev) when working with code in this repository.

## High-Level Architecture

The FMLA Unified App is a cross-platform CLI tool that consolidates 270+ legacy FMLA tools and processes into a single portable application:

```
./fmla [command]  â†â”€â”€ Unified CLI Entry Point
    â†“
modules/          â†â”€â”€ Modular Architecture (8 core modules)
â”œâ”€â”€ core/         â†â”€â”€ Status, checkpoints, system health
â”œâ”€â”€ data_pipeline/ â†â”€â”€ 82GBâ†’1.8MB data transformation
â”œâ”€â”€ db_layer/     â†â”€â”€ SQLite database operations (5 databases)
â”œâ”€â”€ memory/       â†â”€â”€ Cross-tab AI memory system (~/.fmla_persistent_ai)
â”œâ”€â”€ claude_threads/ â†â”€â”€ 30-thread Claude orchestration bridge
â”œâ”€â”€ tools_bridge/ â†â”€â”€ Integration layer for 270+ legacy tools
â”œâ”€â”€ tunnel/       â†â”€â”€ SSH tunnel management (192.168.132.63)
â””â”€â”€ failure_tracker/ â†â”€â”€ JSONL logging with checkpoint recovery
    â†“
External Resources:
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/ â†â”€â”€ 270+ legacy scripts
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/*.db   â†â”€â”€ 5 SQLite databases (1.8MB total)
â€¢ SSH Tunnel â†” Windows (192.168.132.63, ports 8888/9999, SOCKS 1080)
â€¢ Mover System: _ledger.json, hash_index.json, conflict routing
```

## Essential Developer Commands

### Bootstrap & Setup
```bash
./bootstrap.sh                    # macOS setup with checkpoint recovery
./bootstrap.ps1                   # Windows PowerShell setup
source env/bin/activate            # Activate Python virtual environment
```

### Core Development Commands
```bash
./fmla status                      # Overall system health check
./fmla tool list                   # Show all 270+ integrated tools  
./fmla data process --resume       # Resume interrupted data pipeline
./fmla db search "medical leave"   # Full-text search across databases
./fmla claude launch 30            # Launch Claude thread orchestration
./fmla failures list               # Recent failures with retry capability
./fmla checkpoint restore <id>     # Restore from recovery checkpoint
```

### Testing & QA
```bash
python -m pytest tests/           # Run full test suite
python -m pytest tests/test_main.py::test_app_status  # Specific test
./fmla tool claude_30_threads.sh status  # Test legacy tool integration
```

### Development Helpers

```bash
./package.sh                       # Create portable distribution bundles
```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## Development Workflow

### Adding a New Module
1. **Create module skeleton:**
   ```bash
   mkdir -p modules/new_module
   touch modules/new_module/__init__.py
   touch modules/new_module/cli.py
   ```

2. **Add CLI entry to main fmla script:**
   ```python
   elif command == "new_module":
       from modules.new_module.cli import handle_new_module_command
       handle_new_module_command(args)
   ```

3. **Write tests:**
   ```python
   # tests/test_new_module.py
   def test_new_module_status():
       result = subprocess.run([str(FMLA_CLI), "new_module", "status"])
       assert result.returncode == 0
   ```

4. **Implement with patterns:**
   - Use `FailureTracker` for error logging
   - Use `CheckpointManager` for long operations  
   - Respect external drive paths
   - Follow JSONL logging format

### Integrating Legacy Tools
1. **Scan tool:** `./fmla tool scan` detects new tools automatically
2. **Test tool:** `./fmla tool your_script.sh --help`
3. **Add tool metadata:** Update tools_bridge/cli.py if special handling needed
4. **Respect user rules:** Maintain _ledger.json, hash_index.json workflows

## Critical Constraints (User Rules)

**NEVER violate these user-specified requirements:**

1. **External Drive Dependency:** `/Volumes/Mac Mini External` must be mounted for all operations
2. **Mover Script Integration:** Preserve _ledger.json per case, hash_index.json globally, CaseID__YYYYMMDD__slug.ext naming
3. **Conflict Routing:** Maintain Needs_Review/Conflicts directory structure  
4. **SSH Tunnel:** Preserve reverse tunnel to 192.168.132.63 (ports 8888, 9999, SOCKS 1080)
5. **Cross-Platform:** Support macOS primary, Windows via SSH tunnel
6. **270+ Tools:** All legacy tools must remain accessible via `./fmla tool <name>`
7. **Windows Environment:** User requires Windows username and IP for terminal/coding purposes

**Input:** 82GB raw FMLA data (2,848 files) on external drive  
**Processing:** Batch pipeline with queue management, retry logic, disk guards  
**Output:** 1.8MB SQLite databases (5 files) with full-text search  
**Recovery:** Checkpoint system allows resumption at any failure point  
**Integration:** 270+ legacy tools remain accessible through unified interface

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## Critical Constraints (User Rules)

**NEVER violate these user-specified requirements:**

1. **External Drive Dependency:** `/Volumes/Mac Mini External` must be mounted for all operations

5. **Cross-Platform:** Support macOS primary, Windows via SSH tunnel
6. **270+ Tools:** All legacy tools must remain accessible via `./fmla tool <name>`
7. **Windows Environment:** User requires Windows username and IP for terminal/coding purposes

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

1. **Create module skeleton:**
   ```bash
   mkdir -p modules/new_module
   touch modules/new_module/__init__.py
   touch modules/new_module/cli.py
   ```

2. **Add CLI entry to main fmla script:**
   ```python
   elif command == "new_module":
       from modules.new_module.cli import handle_new_module_command
       handle_new_module_command(args)
   ```

3. **Write tests:**
   ```python
   # tests/test_new_module.py
   def test_new_module_status():
       result = subprocess.run([str(FMLA_CLI), "new_module", "status"])
       assert result.returncode == 0
   ```

4. **Implement with patterns:**
   - Use `FailureTracker` for error logging
   - Use `CheckpointManager` for long operations  
   - Respect external drive paths
   - Follow JSONL logging format

### Integrating Legacy Tools
1. **Scan tool:** `./fmla tool scan` detects new tools automatically
2. **Test tool:** `./fmla tool your_script.sh --help`
3. **Add tool metadata:** Update tools_bridge/cli.py if special handling needed
4. **Respect user rules:** Maintain _ledger.json, hash_index.json workflows

```python
from modules.core.checkpoint_manager import CheckpointManager

                                     {"total_files": 100})
```

```python
from modules.failure_tracker.tracker import FailureTracker

                                context={"db_file": "content_search.db"})
```

## Critical Constraints (User Rules)

**NEVER violate these user-specified requirements:**

1. **External Drive Dependency:** `/Volumes/Mac Mini External` must be mounted for all operations
2. **Mover Script Integration:** Preserve _ledger.json per case, hash_index.json globally, CaseID__YYYYMMDD__slug.ext naming
3. **Conflict Routing:** Maintain Needs_Review/Conflicts directory structure  
4. **SSH Tunnel:** Preserve reverse tunnel to 192.168.132.63 (ports 8888, 9999, SOCKS 1080)
5. **Cross-Platform:** Support macOS primary, Windows via SSH tunnel
6. **270+ Tools:** All legacy tools must remain accessible via `./fmla tool <name>`
7. **Windows Environment:** User requires Windows username and IP for terminal/coding purposes

**Input:** 82GB raw FMLA data (2,848 files) on external drive  
**Processing:** Batch pipeline with queue management, retry logic, disk guards  
**Output:** 1.8MB SQLite databases (5 files) with full-text search  
**Recovery:** Checkpoint system allows resumption at any failure point  
**Integration:** 270+ legacy tools remain accessible through unified interface

## High-Level Architecture

```
./fmla [command]  â†â”€â”€ Unified CLI Entry Point
    â†“
modules/          â†â”€â”€ Modular Architecture (8 core modules)
â”œâ”€â”€ core/         â†â”€â”€ Status, checkpoints, system health
â”œâ”€â”€ data_pipeline/ â†â”€â”€ 82GBâ†’1.8MB data transformation
â”œâ”€â”€ db_layer/     â†â”€â”€ SQLite database operations (5 databases)
â”œâ”€â”€ memory/       â†â”€â”€ Cross-tab AI memory system (~/.fmla_persistent_ai)
â”œâ”€â”€ claude_threads/ â†â”€â”€ 30-thread Claude orchestration bridge
â”œâ”€â”€ tools_bridge/ â†â”€â”€ Integration layer for 270+ legacy tools
â”œâ”€â”€ tunnel/       â†â”€â”€ SSH tunnel management (192.168.132.63)

    â†“
External Resources:

â€¢ SSH Tunnel â†” Windows (192.168.132.63, ports 8888/9999, SOCKS 1080)
â€¢ Mover System: _ledger.json, hash_index.json, conflict routing
```

## Essential Developer Commands

### Bootstrap & Setup
```bash
./bootstrap.sh                    # macOS setup with checkpoint recovery
./bootstrap.ps1                   # Windows PowerShell setup
source env/bin/activate            # Activate Python virtual environment
```

### Core Development Commands
```bash
./fmla status                      # Overall system health check
./fmla tool list                   # Show all 270+ integrated tools  
./fmla data process --resume       # Resume interrupted data pipeline
./fmla db search "medical leave"   # Full-text search across databases
./fmla claude launch 30            # Launch Claude thread orchestration
./fmla failures list               # Recent failures with retry capability
./fmla checkpoint restore <id>     # Restore from recovery checkpoint
```

### Testing & QA
```bash
python -m pytest tests/           # Run full test suite
python -m pytest tests/test_main.py::test_app_status  # Specific test
./fmla tool claude_30_threads.sh status  # Test legacy tool integration
```

### Development Helpers
```bash
./fmla memory cleanup              # Clean old AI memory entries
./fmla failures export             # Export failure data for analysis
./package.sh                       # Create portable distribution bundles
```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## High-Level Architecture

The FMLA Unified App is a cross-platform CLI tool that consolidates 270+ legacy FMLA tools and processes into a single portable application:

```
./fmla [command]  â†â”€â”€ Unified CLI Entry Point
    â†“
modules/          â†â”€â”€ Modular Architecture (8 core modules)
â”œâ”€â”€ core/         â†â”€â”€ Status, checkpoints, system health
â”œâ”€â”€ data_pipeline/ â†â”€â”€ 82GBâ†’1.8MB data transformation
â”œâ”€â”€ db_layer/     â†â”€â”€ SQLite database operations (5 databases)
â”œâ”€â”€ memory/       â†â”€â”€ Cross-tab AI memory system (~/.fmla_persistent_ai)
â”œâ”€â”€ claude_threads/ â†â”€â”€ 30-thread Claude orchestration bridge
â”œâ”€â”€ tools_bridge/ â†â”€â”€ Integration layer for 270+ legacy tools
â”œâ”€â”€ tunnel/       â†â”€â”€ SSH tunnel management (192.168.132.63)
â””â”€â”€ failure_tracker/ â†â”€â”€ JSONL logging with checkpoint recovery
    â†“
External Resources:
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/ â†â”€â”€ 270+ legacy scripts
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/*.db   â†â”€â”€ 5 SQLite databases (1.8MB total)
â€¢ SSH Tunnel â†” Windows (192.168.132.63, ports 8888/9999, SOCKS 1080)
â€¢ Mover System: _ledger.json, hash_index.json, conflict routing
```

## Essential Developer Commands

### Bootstrap & Setup




## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## High-Level Architecture

The FMLA Unified App is a cross-platform CLI tool that consolidates 270+ legacy FMLA tools and processes into a single portable application:

```
./fmla [command]  â†â”€â”€ Unified CLI Entry Point
    â†“
modules/          â†â”€â”€ Modular Architecture (8 core modules)
â”œâ”€â”€ core/         â†â”€â”€ Status, checkpoints, system health
â”œâ”€â”€ data_pipeline/ â†â”€â”€ 82GBâ†’1.8MB data transformation
â”œâ”€â”€ db_layer/     â†â”€â”€ SQLite database operations (5 databases)
â”œâ”€â”€ memory/       â†â”€â”€ Cross-tab AI memory system (~/.fmla_persistent_ai)
â”œâ”€â”€ claude_threads/ â†â”€â”€ 30-thread Claude orchestration bridge
â”œâ”€â”€ tools_bridge/ â†â”€â”€ Integration layer for 270+ legacy tools
â”œâ”€â”€ tunnel/       â†â”€â”€ SSH tunnel management (192.168.132.63)
â””â”€â”€ failure_tracker/ â†â”€â”€ JSONL logging with checkpoint recovery
    â†“
External Resources:
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/ â†â”€â”€ 270+ legacy scripts
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/*.db   â†â”€â”€ 5 SQLite databases (1.8MB total)
â€¢ SSH Tunnel â†” Windows (192.168.132.63, ports 8888/9999, SOCKS 1080)
â€¢ Mover System: _ledger.json, hash_index.json, conflict routing
```

## Essential Developer Commands

### Bootstrap & Setup
```bash
./bootstrap.sh                    # macOS setup with checkpoint recovery
./bootstrap.ps1                   # Windows PowerShell setup
source env/bin/activate            # Activate Python virtual environment
```

### Core Development Commands
```bash
./fmla status                      # Overall system health check
./fmla tool list                   # Show all 270+ integrated tools  
./fmla data process --resume       # Resume interrupted data pipeline
./fmla db search "medical leave"   # Full-text search across databases
./fmla claude launch 30            # Launch Claude thread orchestration
./fmla failures list               # Recent failures with retry capability
./fmla checkpoint restore <id>     # Restore from recovery checkpoint
```

### Testing & QA
```bash
python -m pytest tests/           # Run full test suite
python -m pytest tests/test_main.py::test_app_status  # Specific test
./fmla tool claude_30_threads.sh status  # Test legacy tool integration
```

### Development Helpers
```bash
./fmla memory cleanup              # Clean old AI memory entries
./fmla failures export             # Export failure data for analysis
./package.sh                       # Create portable distribution bundles
```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## Development Workflow

### Adding a New Module
1. **Create module skeleton:**
   ```bash
   mkdir -p modules/new_module
   touch modules/new_module/__init__.py
   touch modules/new_module/cli.py
   ```

2. **Add CLI entry to main fmla script:**
   ```python
   elif command == "new_module":
       from modules.new_module.cli import handle_new_module_command
       handle_new_module_command(args)
   ```

3. **Write tests:**
   ```python
   # tests/test_new_module.py
   def test_new_module_status():
       result = subprocess.run([str(FMLA_CLI), "new_module", "status"])
       assert result.returncode == 0
   ```

4. **Implement with patterns:**
   - Use `FailureTracker` for error logging
   - Use `CheckpointManager` for long operations  
   - Respect external drive paths
   - Follow JSONL logging format

### Integrating Legacy Tools
1. **Scan tool:** `./fmla tool scan` detects new tools automatically
2. **Test tool:** `./fmla tool your_script.sh --help`
3. **Add tool metadata:** Update tools_bridge/cli.py if special handling needed
4. **Respect user rules:** Maintain _ledger.json, hash_index.json workflows

### Create Checkpoint in Long-Running Script  
```python
from modules.core.checkpoint_manager import CheckpointManager
```

```python
from modules.failure_tracker.tracker import FailureTracker

```

## Critical Constraints (User Rules)

**NEVER violate these user-specified requirements:**

1. **External Drive Dependency:** `/Volumes/Mac Mini External` must be mounted for all operations
2. **Mover Script Integration:** Preserve _ledger.json per case, hash_index.json globally, CaseID__YYYYMMDD__slug.ext naming
3. **Conflict Routing:** Maintain Needs_Review/Conflicts directory structure  
4. **SSH Tunnel:** Preserve reverse tunnel to 192.168.132.63 (ports 8888, 9999, SOCKS 1080)
5. **Cross-Platform:** Support macOS primary, Windows via SSH tunnel
6. **270+ Tools:** All legacy tools must remain accessible via `./fmla tool <name>`
7. **Windows Environment:** User requires Windows username and IP for terminal/coding purposes

## Data Flow Summary

**Input:** 82GB raw FMLA data (2,848 files) on external drive  
**Processing:** Batch pipeline with queue management, retry logic, disk guards  
**Output:** 1.8MB SQLite databases (5 files) with full-text search  
**Recovery:** Checkpoint system allows resumption at any failure point  
**Integration:** 270+ legacy tools remain accessible through unified interface

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## High-Level Architecture

The FMLA Unified App is a cross-platform CLI tool that consolidates 270+ legacy FMLA tools and processes into a single portable application:

```
./fmla [command]  â†â”€â”€ Unified CLI Entry Point
    â†“
modules/          â†â”€â”€ Modular Architecture (8 core modules)
â”œâ”€â”€ core/         â†â”€â”€ Status, checkpoints, system health
â”œâ”€â”€ data_pipeline/ â†â”€â”€ 82GBâ†’1.8MB data transformation
â”œâ”€â”€ db_layer/     â†â”€â”€ SQLite database operations (5 databases)
â”œâ”€â”€ memory/       â†â”€â”€ Cross-tab AI memory system (~/.fmla_persistent_ai)
â”œâ”€â”€ claude_threads/ â†â”€â”€ 30-thread Claude orchestration bridge
â”œâ”€â”€ tools_bridge/ â†â”€â”€ Integration layer for 270+ legacy tools
â”œâ”€â”€ tunnel/       â†â”€â”€ SSH tunnel management (192.168.132.63)
â””â”€â”€ failure_tracker/ â†â”€â”€ JSONL logging with checkpoint recovery
    â†“
External Resources:
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/ â†â”€â”€ 270+ legacy scripts
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/*.db   â†â”€â”€ 5 SQLite databases (1.8MB total)
â€¢ SSH Tunnel â†” Windows (192.168.132.63, ports 8888/9999, SOCKS 1080)
â€¢ Mover System: _ledger.json, hash_index.json, conflict routing
```

## Essential Developer Commands

### Bootstrap & Setup
```bash
./bootstrap.sh                    # macOS setup with checkpoint recovery
./bootstrap.ps1                   # Windows PowerShell setup
source env/bin/activate            # Activate Python virtual environment
```

### Core Development Commands
```bash
./fmla status                      # Overall system health check
./fmla tool list                   # Show all 270+ integrated tools  
./fmla data process --resume       # Resume interrupted data pipeline
./fmla db search "medical leave"   # Full-text search across databases
./fmla claude launch 30            # Launch Claude thread orchestration
./fmla failures list               # Recent failures with retry capability
./fmla checkpoint restore <id>     # Restore from recovery checkpoint
```

### Testing & QA
```bash
python -m pytest tests/           # Run full test suite
python -m pytest tests/test_main.py::test_app_status  # Specific test
./fmla tool claude_30_threads.sh status  # Test legacy tool integration
```

### Development Helpers
```bash
./fmla memory cleanup              # Clean old AI memory entries
./fmla failures export             # Export failure data for analysis
./package.sh                       # Create portable distribution bundles
```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## File Structure & Critical Dependencies

```
fmla_app/
â”œâ”€â”€ fmla                    # Main CLI executable (Python script)
â”œâ”€â”€ bootstrap.sh/.ps1       # Cross-platform setup with checkpoints
â”œâ”€â”€ package.sh              # Distribution bundle creation
â”œâ”€â”€ modules/                # Core functionality (8 modules)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ core/               # status.py, checkpoint_manager.py

```

## Development Workflow

### Adding a New Module
1. **Create module skeleton:**
   ```bash
   mkdir -p modules/new_module
   touch modules/new_module/__init__.py
   touch modules/new_module/cli.py
   ```

2. **Add CLI entry to main fmla script:**
   ```python
   elif command == "new_module":
       from modules.new_module.cli import handle_new_module_command
       handle_new_module_command(args)
   ```

3. **Write tests:**
   ```python
   # tests/test_new_module.py
   def test_new_module_status():
       result = subprocess.run([str(FMLA_CLI), "new_module", "status"])
       assert result.returncode == 0
   ```

4. **Implement with patterns:**
   - Use `FailureTracker` for error logging
   - Use `CheckpointManager` for long operations  
   - Respect external drive paths
   - Follow JSONL logging format

### Integrating Legacy Tools
1. **Scan tool:** `./fmla tool scan` detects new tools automatically
2. **Test tool:** `./fmla tool your_script.sh --help`
3. **Add tool metadata:** Update tools_bridge/cli.py if special handling needed
4. **Respect user rules:** Maintain _ledger.json, hash_index.json workflows

### Add New CLI Subcommand

```python
    if not args:
        show_module_status()
        return
    
    subcommand = args[0]
    if subcommand == "process":
        # Implementation with checkpoint support
        pass
```

### Create Checkpoint in Long-Running Script  
```python
from modules.core.checkpoint_manager import CheckpointManager
mgr = CheckpointManager()
checkpoint_id = mgr.create_checkpoint("processing", "batch_extract", 
                                     {"total_files": 100})
# ... do work ...
mgr.update_checkpoint(checkpoint_id, "completed", {"processed": 100})
```

### Log Structured Failure
```python
from modules.failure_tracker.tracker import FailureTracker
tracker = FailureTracker()
failure_id = tracker.log_failure("Database connection timeout", 
                                command="db", 
                                context={"db_file": "content_search.db"})
```

## Critical Constraints (User Rules)

**NEVER violate these user-specified requirements:**

1. **External Drive Dependency:** `/Volumes/Mac Mini External` must be mounted for all operations
2. **Mover Script Integration:** Preserve _ledger.json per case, hash_index.json globally, CaseID__YYYYMMDD__slug.ext naming
3. **Conflict Routing:** Maintain Needs_Review/Conflicts directory structure  
4. **SSH Tunnel:** Preserve reverse tunnel to 192.168.132.63 (ports 8888, 9999, SOCKS 1080)
5. **Cross-Platform:** Support macOS primary, Windows via SSH tunnel
6. **270+ Tools:** All legacy tools must remain accessible via `./fmla tool <name>`
7. **Windows Environment:** User requires Windows username and IP for terminal/coding purposes

## Data Flow Summary

**Input:** 82GB raw FMLA data (2,848 files) on external drive  
**Processing:** Batch pipeline with queue management, retry logic, disk guards  
**Output:** 1.8MB SQLite databases (5 files) with full-text search  
**Recovery:** Checkpoint system allows resumption at any failure point  
**Integration:** 270+ legacy tools remain accessible through unified interface

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## High-Level Architecture

The FMLA Unified App is a cross-platform CLI tool that consolidates 270+ legacy FMLA tools and processes into a single portable application:

```
./fmla [command]  â†â”€â”€ Unified CLI Entry Point
    â†“
modules/          â†â”€â”€ Modular Architecture (8 core modules)
â”œâ”€â”€ core/         â†â”€â”€ Status, checkpoints, system health
â”œâ”€â”€ data_pipeline/ â†â”€â”€ 82GBâ†’1.8MB data transformation
â”œâ”€â”€ db_layer/     â†â”€â”€ SQLite database operations (5 databases)
â”œâ”€â”€ memory/       â†â”€â”€ Cross-tab AI memory system (~/.fmla_persistent_ai)
â”œâ”€â”€ claude_threads/ â†â”€â”€ 30-thread Claude orchestration bridge
â”œâ”€â”€ tools_bridge/ â†â”€â”€ Integration layer for 270+ legacy tools
â”œâ”€â”€ tunnel/       â†â”€â”€ SSH tunnel management (192.168.132.63)
â””â”€â”€ failure_tracker/ â†â”€â”€ JSONL logging with checkpoint recovery
    â†“
External Resources:
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/ â†â”€â”€ 270+ legacy scripts
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/*.db   â†â”€â”€ 5 SQLite databases (1.8MB total)
â€¢ SSH Tunnel â†” Windows (192.168.132.63, ports 8888/9999, SOCKS 1080)
â€¢ Mover System: _ledger.json, hash_index.json, conflict routing
```

## Essential Developer Commands

### Bootstrap & Setup
```bash
./bootstrap.sh                    # macOS setup with checkpoint recovery
./bootstrap.ps1                   # Windows PowerShell setup
source env/bin/activate            # Activate Python virtual environment
```

### Core Development Commands
```bash
./fmla status                      # Overall system health check
./fmla tool list                   # Show all 270+ integrated tools  
./fmla data process --resume       # Resume interrupted data pipeline
./fmla db search "medical leave"   # Full-text search across databases
./fmla claude launch 30            # Launch Claude thread orchestration
./fmla failures list               # Recent failures with retry capability
./fmla checkpoint restore <id>     # Restore from recovery checkpoint
```

### Testing & QA
```bash
python -m pytest tests/           # Run full test suite
python -m pytest tests/test_main.py::test_app_status  # Specific test
./fmla tool claude_30_threads.sh status  # Test legacy tool integration
```

### Development Helpers
```bash
./fmla memory cleanup              # Clean old AI memory entries
./fmla failures export             # Export failure data for analysis
./package.sh                       # Create portable distribution bundles
```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

```
fmla_app/
```

## Development Workflow

### Adding a New Module
1. **Create module skeleton:**
   ```bash
   mkdir -p modules/new_module
   touch modules/new_module/__init__.py
   touch modules/new_module/cli.py
   ```

2. **Add CLI entry to main fmla script:**
   ```python
   elif command == "new_module":
       from modules.new_module.cli import handle_new_module_command
       handle_new_module_command(args)
   ```

3. **Write tests:**
   ```python
   # tests/test_new_module.py
   def test_new_module_status():
       result = subprocess.run([str(FMLA_CLI), "new_module", "status"])
       assert result.returncode == 0
   ```

4. **Implement with patterns:**
   - Use `FailureTracker` for error logging
   - Use `CheckpointManager` for long operations  
   - Respect external drive paths
   - Follow JSONL logging format

### Integrating Legacy Tools
1. **Scan tool:** `./fmla tool scan` detects new tools automatically
2. **Test tool:** `./fmla tool your_script.sh --help`
3. **Add tool metadata:** Update tools_bridge/cli.py if special handling needed
4. **Respect user rules:** Maintain _ledger.json, hash_index.json workflows

## Quick Reference Templates

### Add New CLI Subcommand
```python
def handle_module_command(args: List[str]) -> None:
    if not args:
        show_module_status()
        return
    
    subcommand = args[0]
    if subcommand == "process":
        # Implementation with checkpoint support
        pass
```

### Create Checkpoint in Long-Running Script  
```python
from modules.core.checkpoint_manager import CheckpointManager
mgr = CheckpointManager()
checkpoint_id = mgr.create_checkpoint("processing", "batch_extract", 
                                     {"total_files": 100})
# ... do work ...
mgr.update_checkpoint(checkpoint_id, "completed", {"processed": 100})
```

### Log Structured Failure
```python
from modules.failure_tracker.tracker import FailureTracker
tracker = FailureTracker()
failure_id = tracker.log_failure("Database connection timeout", 
                                command="db", 
                                context={"db_file": "content_search.db"})
```

## Critical Constraints (User Rules)

**NEVER violate these user-specified requirements:**

1. **External Drive Dependency:** `/Volumes/Mac Mini External` must be mounted for all operations
2. **Mover Script Integration:** Preserve _ledger.json per case, hash_index.json globally, CaseID__YYYYMMDD__slug.ext naming
3. **Conflict Routing:** Maintain Needs_Review/Conflicts directory structure  
4. **SSH Tunnel:** Preserve reverse tunnel to 192.168.132.63 (ports 8888, 9999, SOCKS 1080)
5. **Cross-Platform:** Support macOS primary, Windows via SSH tunnel
6. **270+ Tools:** All legacy tools must remain accessible via `./fmla tool <name>`
7. **Windows Environment:** User requires Windows username and IP for terminal/coding purposes

## Data Flow Summary

**Input:** 82GB raw FMLA data (2,848 files) on external drive  
**Processing:** Batch pipeline with queue management, retry logic, disk guards  
**Output:** 1.8MB SQLite databases (5 files) with full-text search  
**Recovery:** Checkpoint system allows resumption at any failure point  
**Integration:** 270+ legacy tools remain accessible through unified interface

   ```python
   elif command == "new_module":
   ```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

This file provides guidance to WARP (warp.dev) when working with code in this repository.

## High-Level Architecture

The FMLA Unified App is a cross-platform CLI tool that consolidates 270+ legacy FMLA tools and processes into a single portable application:

```
./fmla [command]  â†â”€â”€ Unified CLI Entry Point
    â†“
modules/          â†â”€â”€ Modular Architecture (8 core modules)
â”œâ”€â”€ core/         â†â”€â”€ Status, checkpoints, system health
â”œâ”€â”€ data_pipeline/ â†â”€â”€ 82GBâ†’1.8MB data transformation
â”œâ”€â”€ db_layer/     â†â”€â”€ SQLite database operations (5 databases)
â”œâ”€â”€ memory/       â†â”€â”€ Cross-tab AI memory system (~/.fmla_persistent_ai)
â”œâ”€â”€ claude_threads/ â†â”€â”€ 30-thread Claude orchestration bridge
â”œâ”€â”€ tools_bridge/ â†â”€â”€ Integration layer for 270+ legacy tools
â”œâ”€â”€ tunnel/       â†â”€â”€ SSH tunnel management (192.168.132.63)
â””â”€â”€ failure_tracker/ â†â”€â”€ JSONL logging with checkpoint recovery
    â†“
External Resources:
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/ â†â”€â”€ 270+ legacy scripts
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/*.db   â†â”€â”€ 5 SQLite databases (1.8MB total)
â€¢ SSH Tunnel â†” Windows (192.168.132.63, ports 8888/9999, SOCKS 1080)
â€¢ Mover System: _ledger.json, hash_index.json, conflict routing
```

## Essential Developer Commands

### Bootstrap & Setup
```bash
./bootstrap.sh                    # macOS setup with checkpoint recovery
./bootstrap.ps1                   # Windows PowerShell setup
source env/bin/activate            # Activate Python virtual environment
```

### Core Development Commands
```bash
./fmla status                      # Overall system health check
./fmla tool list                   # Show all 270+ integrated tools  
./fmla data process --resume       # Resume interrupted data pipeline
./fmla db search "medical leave"   # Full-text search across databases
./fmla claude launch 30            # Launch Claude thread orchestration
./fmla failures list               # Recent failures with retry capability
./fmla checkpoint restore <id>     # Restore from recovery checkpoint
```

### Testing & QA
```bash
python -m pytest tests/           # Run full test suite
python -m pytest tests/test_main.py::test_app_status  # Specific test
./fmla tool claude_30_threads.sh status  # Test legacy tool integration
```

### Development Helpers
```bash
./fmla memory cleanup              # Clean old AI memory entries
./fmla failures export             # Export failure data for analysis
./package.sh                       # Create portable distribution bundles
```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## Development Workflow

### Adding a New Module
1. **Create module skeleton:**
   ```bash
   mkdir -p modules/new_module
   touch modules/new_module/__init__.py
   touch modules/new_module/cli.py
   ```

2. **Add CLI entry to main fmla script:**
   ```python
   elif command == "new_module":
       from modules.new_module.cli import handle_new_module_command
       handle_new_module_command(args)
   ```

3. **Write tests:**
   ```python
   # tests/test_new_module.py
   def test_new_module_status():
       result = subprocess.run([str(FMLA_CLI), "new_module", "status"])
       assert result.returncode == 0
   ```

4. **Implement with patterns:**
   - Use `FailureTracker` for error logging
   - Use `CheckpointManager` for long operations  
   - Respect external drive paths
   - Follow JSONL logging format

### Integrating Legacy Tools
1. **Scan tool:** `./fmla tool scan` detects new tools automatically
2. **Test tool:** `./fmla tool your_script.sh --help`
3. **Add tool metadata:** Update tools_bridge/cli.py if special handling needed
4. **Respect user rules:** Maintain _ledger.json, hash_index.json workflows

## Quick Reference Templates

### Add New CLI Subcommand
```python
def handle_module_command(args: List[str]) -> None:
    if not args:
        show_module_status()
        return
    
    subcommand = args[0]
    if subcommand == "process":
        # Implementation with checkpoint support
        pass
```

### Create Checkpoint in Long-Running Script  
```python
from modules.core.checkpoint_manager import CheckpointManager
mgr = CheckpointManager()
checkpoint_id = mgr.create_checkpoint("processing", "batch_extract", 
                                     {"total_files": 100})
# ... do work ...
mgr.update_checkpoint(checkpoint_id, "completed", {"processed": 100})
```

### Log Structured Failure
```python
from modules.failure_tracker.tracker import FailureTracker
tracker = FailureTracker()
failure_id = tracker.log_failure("Database connection timeout", 
                                command="db", 
                                context={"db_file": "content_search.db"})
```

## Critical Constraints (User Rules)

**NEVER violate these user-specified requirements:**

1. **External Drive Dependency:** `/Volumes/Mac Mini External` must be mounted for all operations
2. **Mover Script Integration:** Preserve _ledger.json per case, hash_index.json globally, CaseID__YYYYMMDD__slug.ext naming
3. **Conflict Routing:** Maintain Needs_Review/Conflicts directory structure  
4. **SSH Tunnel:** Preserve reverse tunnel to 192.168.132.63 (ports 8888, 9999, SOCKS 1080)
5. **Cross-Platform:** Support macOS primary, Windows via SSH tunnel
6. **270+ Tools:** All legacy tools must remain accessible via `./fmla tool <name>`
7. **Windows Environment:** User requires Windows username and IP for terminal/coding purposes

## Data Flow Summary

**Input:** 82GB raw FMLA data (2,848 files) on external drive  
**Processing:** Batch pipeline with queue management, retry logic, disk guards  
**Output:** 1.8MB SQLite databases (5 files) with full-text search  
**Recovery:** Checkpoint system allows resumption at any failure point  
**Integration:** 270+ legacy tools remain accessible through unified interface

This file provides guidance to WARP (warp.dev) when working with code in this repository.

## High-Level Architecture

The FMLA Unified App is a cross-platform CLI tool that consolidates 270+ legacy FMLA tools and processes into a single portable application:

```
./fmla [command]  â†â”€â”€ Unified CLI Entry Point
    â†“
modules/          â†â”€â”€ Modular Architecture (8 core modules)
â”œâ”€â”€ core/         â†â”€â”€ Status, checkpoints, system health
â”œâ”€â”€ data_pipeline/ â†â”€â”€ 82GBâ†’1.8MB data transformation
â”œâ”€â”€ db_layer/     â†â”€â”€ SQLite database operations (5 databases)
â”œâ”€â”€ memory/       â†â”€â”€ Cross-tab AI memory system (~/.fmla_persistent_ai)
â”œâ”€â”€ claude_threads/ â†â”€â”€ 30-thread Claude orchestration bridge
â”œâ”€â”€ tools_bridge/ â†â”€â”€ Integration layer for 270+ legacy tools
â”œâ”€â”€ tunnel/       â†â”€â”€ SSH tunnel management (192.168.132.63)
â””â”€â”€ failure_tracker/ â†â”€â”€ JSONL logging with checkpoint recovery
    â†“
External Resources:
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/ â†â”€â”€ 270+ legacy scripts
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/*.db   â†â”€â”€ 5 SQLite databases (1.8MB total)
â€¢ SSH Tunnel â†” Windows (192.168.132.63, ports 8888/9999, SOCKS 1080)
â€¢ Mover System: _ledger.json, hash_index.json, conflict routing
```

## Essential Developer Commands

### Bootstrap & Setup
```bash
./bootstrap.sh                    # macOS setup with checkpoint recovery
./bootstrap.ps1                   # Windows PowerShell setup
source env/bin/activate            # Activate Python virtual environment
```

### Core Development Commands
```bash
./fmla status                      # Overall system health check
./fmla tool list                   # Show all 270+ integrated tools  
./fmla data process --resume       # Resume interrupted data pipeline
./fmla db search "medical leave"   # Full-text search across databases
./fmla claude launch 30            # Launch Claude thread orchestration
./fmla failures list               # Recent failures with retry capability
./fmla checkpoint restore <id>     # Restore from recovery checkpoint
```

### Testing & QA
```bash
python -m pytest tests/           # Run full test suite
python -m pytest tests/test_main.py::test_app_status  # Specific test
./fmla tool claude_30_threads.sh status  # Test legacy tool integration
```

### Development Helpers
```bash
./fmla memory cleanup              # Clean old AI memory entries
./fmla failures export             # Export failure data for analysis
./package.sh                       # Create portable distribution bundles
```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## File Structure & Critical Dependencies

```
fmla_app/
â”œâ”€â”€ fmla                    # Main CLI executable (Python script)
â”œâ”€â”€ bootstrap.sh/.ps1       # Cross-platform setup with checkpoints
â”œâ”€â”€ package.sh              # Distribution bundle creation
â”œâ”€â”€ modules/                # Core functionality (8 modules)

â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tools_bridge/       # Legacy tool integration (270+ tools)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ failure_tracker/    # tracker.py (JSONL logging)
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ */cli.py           # Each module's CLI handler
â”œâ”€â”€ config/

External Dependencies (CRITICAL):
/Volumes/Mac Mini External/  â†â”€â”€ MUST be mounted

â”œâ”€â”€ *.db                     â†â”€â”€ 5 SQLite databases (content_search, etc.)
â””â”€â”€ FMLA_Claude/            â†â”€â”€ Claude thread configurations

User Rules Integration:
â€¢ _ledger.json per case (file history tracking)  
â€¢ hash_index.json (global duplicate detection)
â€¢ Needs_Review/Conflicts/ (conflict routing)
â€¢ Filename normalization: CaseID__YYYYMMDD__slug.ext
```

## Development Workflow

### Adding a New Module
1. **Create module skeleton:**
   ```bash
   mkdir -p modules/new_module
   touch modules/new_module/__init__.py
   touch modules/new_module/cli.py
   ```

2. **Add CLI entry to main fmla script:**
   ```python
   elif command == "new_module":
       from modules.new_module.cli import handle_new_module_command
       handle_new_module_command(args)
   ```

3. **Write tests:**
   ```python
   # tests/test_new_module.py
   def test_new_module_status():
       result = subprocess.run([str(FMLA_CLI), "new_module", "status"])
       assert result.returncode == 0
   ```

4. **Implement with patterns:**
   - Use `FailureTracker` for error logging
   - Use `CheckpointManager` for long operations  
   - Respect external drive paths
   - Follow JSONL logging format

### Integrating Legacy Tools
1. **Scan tool:** `./fmla tool scan` detects new tools automatically
2. **Test tool:** `./fmla tool your_script.sh --help`
3. **Add tool metadata:** Update tools_bridge/cli.py if special handling needed
4. **Respect user rules:** Maintain _ledger.json, hash_index.json workflows

## Quick Reference Templates

### Add New CLI Subcommand
```python
def handle_module_command(args: List[str]) -> None:
    if not args:
        show_module_status()
        return
    
    subcommand = args[0]
    if subcommand == "process":
        # Implementation with checkpoint support
        pass
```

### Create Checkpoint in Long-Running Script  
```python
from modules.core.checkpoint_manager import CheckpointManager
mgr = CheckpointManager()
checkpoint_id = mgr.create_checkpoint("processing", "batch_extract", 
                                     {"total_files": 100})
# ... do work ...
mgr.update_checkpoint(checkpoint_id, "completed", {"processed": 100})
```

### Log Structured Failure
```python
from modules.failure_tracker.tracker import FailureTracker
tracker = FailureTracker()
failure_id = tracker.log_failure("Database connection timeout", 
                                command="db", 
                                context={"db_file": "content_search.db"})
```

## Critical Constraints (User Rules)

**NEVER violate these user-specified requirements:**

1. **External Drive Dependency:** `/Volumes/Mac Mini External` must be mounted for all operations
2. **Mover Script Integration:** Preserve _ledger.json per case, hash_index.json globally, CaseID__YYYYMMDD__slug.ext naming
3. **Conflict Routing:** Maintain Needs_Review/Conflicts directory structure  
4. **SSH Tunnel:** Preserve reverse tunnel to 192.168.132.63 (ports 8888, 9999, SOCKS 1080)
5. **Cross-Platform:** Support macOS primary, Windows via SSH tunnel
6. **270+ Tools:** All legacy tools must remain accessible via `./fmla tool <name>`
7. **Windows Environment:** User requires Windows username and IP for terminal/coding purposes

## Data Flow Summary

**Input:** 82GB raw FMLA data (2,848 files) on external drive  
**Processing:** Batch pipeline with queue management, retry logic, disk guards  
**Output:** 1.8MB SQLite databases (5 files) with full-text search  
**Recovery:** Checkpoint system allows resumption at any failure point

## High-Level Architecture

The FMLA Unified App is a cross-platform CLI tool that consolidates 270+ legacy FMLA tools and processes into a single portable application:

```
./fmla [command]  â†â”€â”€ Unified CLI Entry Point
    â†“
modules/          â†â”€â”€ Modular Architecture (8 core modules)
â”œâ”€â”€ core/         â†â”€â”€ Status, checkpoints, system health
â”œâ”€â”€ data_pipeline/ â†â”€â”€ 82GBâ†’1.8MB data transformation
â”œâ”€â”€ db_layer/     â†â”€â”€ SQLite database operations (5 databases)
â”œâ”€â”€ memory/       â†â”€â”€ Cross-tab AI memory system (~/.fmla_persistent_ai)
â”œâ”€â”€ claude_threads/ â†â”€â”€ 30-thread Claude orchestration bridge
â”œâ”€â”€ tools_bridge/ â†â”€â”€ Integration layer for 270+ legacy tools
â”œâ”€â”€ tunnel/       â†â”€â”€ SSH tunnel management (192.168.132.63)
â””â”€â”€ failure_tracker/ â†â”€â”€ JSONL logging with checkpoint recovery
    â†“
External Resources:
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/ â†â”€â”€ 270+ legacy scripts
â€¢ /Volumes/Mac Mini External/*.db   â†â”€â”€ 5 SQLite databases (1.8MB total)
â€¢ SSH Tunnel â†” Windows (192.168.132.63, ports 8888/9999, SOCKS 1080)
â€¢ Mover System: _ledger.json, hash_index.json, conflict routing
```

## Essential Developer Commands

### Bootstrap & Setup
```bash
./bootstrap.sh                    # macOS setup with checkpoint recovery
./bootstrap.ps1                   # Windows PowerShell setup
source env/bin/activate            # Activate Python virtual environment
```

### Core Development Commands
```bash
./fmla status                      # Overall system health check
./fmla tool list                   # Show all 270+ integrated tools  
./fmla data process --resume       # Resume interrupted data pipeline
./fmla db search "medical leave"   # Full-text search across databases
./fmla claude launch 30            # Launch Claude thread orchestration
./fmla failures list               # Recent failures with retry capability
./fmla checkpoint restore <id>     # Restore from recovery checkpoint
```

### Testing & QA
```bash
python -m pytest tests/           # Run full test suite
python -m pytest tests/test_main.py::test_app_status  # Specific test
./fmla tool claude_30_threads.sh status  # Test legacy tool integration
```

### Development Helpers
```bash
./fmla memory cleanup              # Clean old AI memory entries
./fmla failures export             # Export failure data for analysis
./package.sh                       # Create portable distribution bundles
```

## Key Architectural Patterns

### 1. Modular CLI Router Pattern
```python
def route_command(command, args):
    if command == "data":
        from modules.data_pipeline.cli import handle_data_command
        handle_data_command(args)
    elif command == "tool":
        from modules.tools_bridge.cli import handle_tool_command
        handle_tool_command(args)
```

### 2. Checkpoint Recovery Pattern
```python
def create_checkpoint(step_name, operation, data=None):
    checkpoint_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    checkpoint_data = {
        "id": checkpoint_id,
        "step_name": step_name,
        "operation": operation,
        "status": "in_progress",
        "data": data or {},
        "files_processed": []
    }
    # Save to checkpoints/ directory for recovery
```

### 3. Failure Tracker JSONL Logging
```python
def log_failure(error, command=None, context=None):
    entry = {
        "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "type": "failure",
        "error": str(error),
        "command": command,
        "context": context or {}
    }
    # Append to logs/failures.jsonl
```

### 4. External Tool Shim Pattern
```python
def execute_tool(tool_name, args):
    tools = scan_available_tools()  # From /Volumes/Mac Mini External/tools/
    tool_info = next((t for t in tools if t['name'] == tool_name), None)
    
    if tool_info['type'] == 'sh':
        cmd = ['bash', str(tool_path)] + args
    # Execute with current working directory preserved
```

## File Structure & Critical Dependencies

```
fmla_app/
â”œâ”€â”€ fmla                    # Main CLI executable (Python script)
â”œâ”€â”€ bootstrap.sh/.ps1       # Cross-platform setup with checkpoints
â”œâ”€â”€ package.sh              # Distribution bundle creation
â”œâ”€â”€ modules/                # Core functionality (8 modules)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ core/               # status.py, checkpoint_manager.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ data_pipeline/      # 82GBâ†’1.8MB transformation logic

```

## Development Workflow

### Adding a New Module
1. **Create module skeleton:**
   ```bash
   mkdir -p modules/new_module
   touch modules/new_module/__init__.py
   touch modules/new_module/cli.py
   ```

2. **Add CLI entry to main fmla script:**
   ```python
   elif command == "new_module":
       from modules.new_module.cli import handle_new_module_command
       handle_new_module_command(args)
   ```

3. **Write tests:**
   ```python
   # tests/test_new_module.py
   def test_new_module_status():
       result = subprocess.run([str(FMLA_CLI), "new_module", "status"])
       assert result.returncode == 0
   ```

4. **Implement with patterns:**
   - Use `FailureTracker` for error logging
   - Use `CheckpointManager` for long operations  
   - Respect external drive paths
   - Follow JSONL logging format

### Integrating Legacy Tools
1. **Scan tool:** `./fmla tool scan` detects new tools automatically
2. **Test tool:** `./fmla tool your_script.sh --help`
3. **Add tool metadata:** Update tools_bridge/cli.py if special handling needed
4. **Respect user rules:** Maintain _ledger.json, hash_index.json workflows
